title: Starliner undocks from the ISS, prepares to return to Earth
summary: After successfully rendezvousing and docking with the International Space Station (ISS), Boeing’s Starliner is now headed back to Earth after a six-day-long mission in low Earth orbit. The spacecraft autonomously undocked from the forward-facing port at the Harmony module of the ISS at 2:36 p.m. today, wrapping up its stay at the orbiting laboratory.

title: BlackSky, Maxar, Planet win 10-year NRO contracts for satellite imagery
summary: The National Reconnaissance Office announced May 25 it awarded BlackSky, Maxar Technologies and Planet Labs 10-year contracts to provide satellite imagery for U.S. intelligence, defense and federal civil agencies.

title: Industry looks to decentralized approaches to space sustainability
summary: As governments make slow progress on space traffic management systems, companies may be able work together more quickly to develop processes to support space sustainability.

title: Earth’s orbital debris problem is worsening, and policy solutions are difficult
summary: "Who's responsible? Who pays? How much do they pay?"

title: NASA Invites Media to Discuss Space Station Science, Climate Research
summary: NASA will host a media teleconference at 1 p.m. EDT Tuesday, June 2, to discuss the hardware, technology demonstrations, and science experiments, including a new climate research investigation, headed to the International Space Station aboard SpaceX’s 25th commercial resupply mission for NASA.
